From: Sent: Friday, August 12, 2011 3:25 AM To: Marcelle Saab Subject: RE: Important Announcement from MBO Partners: New Look and Business From: john westlake <westlakej@hotmail.com>
Marcel,
I have a question.
I am looking at a contract with a company. My usual mode is to go thru a third party who pay me as a W2. The company I work for pay the third party, they pay the Employee tax and any other overheads. They take their 5%, and then I get the remainder.
My questions are:
1) Do you act as the third party?. My previous relation with MBO was were you handled my details for the third party, this time I am trying work without the third party, with possibly MBO filling that role.
Yes, we can act as a third party. The client would pay c2c to MBO Partners, we would then pay you on a W2.
2) If you do act as the third party, what rate do you take for your services?
We charge 5% of the rate that is paid to MBO. We pull this off pre-tax for you and only charge it when the money comes in from the client. There are no obligations, commitments – we are simply paid when you are paid.
I am trying to calculate how much overhead I need to add to the rate I negoitiate with the client to cover your costs, while still paying me my hourly rate.
We can do what is called a net cash estimate or financial illustration showing you what the bill rate to the client would look like being run through MBO with all the deductions/taxes, etc coming out and the net amount. I can run one of these with you over the phone. Just give me a call or schedule time in my online schedule by going here: https://my.timedriver.com/C9CPC.
Hope this makes sense
yours,
John Westlake
Subject: Important Announcement from MBO Partners: New Look and Business Center Interface! Date: Thu, 7 Jul 2011 08:00:22 -0500 To: westlakej@hotmail.com From: msaab@mbopartners.com Dear John,

MBO Partners has been growing quickly. As businesses migrate to the new Project Economy with more and more work being procured on a contract basis, we have emerged as a leader in helping independent workers and their clients work together. As a result, we’re compelled to enhance our messaging and demonstrate how MBO Partners is central to this growing trend.

Last week we also launched a new-and-improved user interface for the online Business Center that’s central to our Associate and client relationships.
We hope you take a moment to explore the new site.
